Variable synonyms: Anthesis to silking interval GDD base 8, ASI
Method description: Calculated as growing-degree units or growing degree days between sowing and 50% anthesis.
Formula:
parameter values (Tb = 8°C and To = 30°C)
that maximized correlations between sites
Method reference: Ritchie J, NeSmith D (1991) Temperature and crop development. Modeling plant and soil systems American Society of Agronomy Madison Wisconsin USA. doi:10.2134/agronmonogr31.c4

Variable synonyms: Female flowering days to silking GDD base 8, FFLW
Male flowering days to anthesis GDD base 8, MFLW
Method name: Growing degree days to anthesis - Computation
Method description: Calculated as growing-degree units or growing degree days between sowing and 50% anthesis.
Formula:
parameter values (Tb = 8°C and To = 32°C)
that maximized correlations between sites
Method reference: Ritchie J, NeSmith D (1991) Temperature and crop development. Modeling plant and soil systems American Society of Agronomy Madison Wisconsin USA. doi:10.2134/agronmonogr31.c4

Method description: Comparative visual observation of plant biomass (length, width, number of leaves) 15 days after sowing.
Method reference: House, L.R. 1987. Manual for the selection of sorghum. Second edition. Patancheru, AP 502 324, India: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics.

Method description:
The plant germination dynamics were measured by counting the number of
visible plants after seeding every 2 days until 50% of plants were visible (days to
emergence: Em)
Method reference: IMIS (International Maize Information System; http://imis.cimmyt.org/) Database, CIMMYT.

Trait description: Plant height from the base to the top part (in reproductive stages to the top of the tassel).
Method description: Recommended to take multiple plants and measure the height from the base of a plant to the top of the tassel, enter the data individually in the FieldBook and calculate the average.
Method reference: DTMA drought phenotyping protocol. 2009. CIMMYT. Magorokosho et al. 2010. Characterization of maize germplasm grown in eastern and southern Africa: Results of the 2009 regional trials coordinated by CIMMYT. Zimbabwe

Trait description: Plant height from base to the insertion of the top (uppermost) ear.
Attribute: height to insertion of uppermost ear
Method description: Recommended to take 6 alternating plants per plot and measure the height between the base of a plant to the insertion of the top (uppermost) ear of the same plant, enter the data individually in the FieldBook and calculate the average.
Method reference: IMIS (International Maize Information System; http://imis.cimmyt.org/) Database, CIMMYT.

Method description: Count the number of tillers per plant (average of more than 20 representative) plants.

Trait description: Ear husk cover observed as degree of the husk covering the tip of the ear.
Method description: Observe the ears hask cover and rate it.

Method reference: IMIS (International Maize Information System; http://imis.cimmyt.org/) Database, CIMMYT.

Trait description: Number of grain rows in the central part of the uppermost ear.
Method description: Count total number of grain rows in the ear.
Method reference: IBPGR, 1991. International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center, Mexico City/International Board for Plant Genetic Resources, Rome. ISBN 9290431891. http://www.bioversityinternational.org/fileadmin/bioversity/publications/pdfs/104.pdf?cache=1328202180

Method description: Count and weigh grains randomly selected from the total grains.
Method reference: IMIS (International Maize Information System; http://imis.cimmyt.org/) Database, CIMMYT.

Trait description: Grain yield per unit area, either field weight basis, dry weight basis or adjusted.
Trait synonyms: grains weight per plant, kernel weight per plant

Method reference: IMIS (International Maize Information System; http://imis.cimmyt.org/) Database, CIMMYT.

Trait description: Grain yield per unit area, either field weight basis, dry weight basis or adjusted.
Trait synonyms: grains weight per plant, kernel weight per plant
Method description: Calculate shelled grain yield per unit area.

Variable synonyms: Female flowering days to silking D20deg, FFLW
Method name: Thermal time between emergence and silking – Computation
Method description: Calculated as equivalent days at 20 °C unit between emergence and 50% anthesis.
Method reference: B. Parent, O. Turc, Y. Gibon, M. Stitt and F. Tardieu (2010) Modelling temperature-compensated physiological rates, based on the co-ordination of responses to temperature of developmental processes. Journal of Experimental Botany 61(8):2057-69 – DOI: 10.1093/jxb/erq003

Variable synonyms: Male flowering days to anthesis D20deg, MFLW
Method name: Thermal time between emergence and to anthesis - Computation
Method description: Calculated as equivalent days at 20 °C unit between emergence and 50% anthesis.
Method reference: B. Parent, O. Turc, Y. Gibon, M. Stitt and F. Tardieu (2010) Modelling temperature-compensated physiological rates, based on the co-ordination of responses to temperature of developmental processes. Journal of Experimental Botany 61(8):2057-69 – DOI: 10.1093/jxb/erq004

Variable synonyms: Anthesis to silking interval D20deg, ASI
Method name: Anthesis silking interval in thermal time – Computation
Method description: Calculated as equivalent days at 20 °C unit between 50% anthesis and silking.
Method reference: B. Parent, O. Turc, Y. Gibon, M. Stitt and F. Tardieu (2010) Modelling temperature-compensated physiological rates, based on the co-ordination of responses to temperature of developmental processes. Journal of Experimental Botany 61(8):2057-69 – DOI: 10.1093/jxb/erq005
